alert.note: Alert for Cloud; Ottawa; Republic (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 2:49PM CDT until April 12 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT TUESDAY FOR DRY FUELS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND GUSTY SOUTHWEST WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 008, 020, AND 034... The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 9 PM CDT Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * WIND...South winds sustained from 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to around 50 mph at times. * HUMIDITY...Minimum relative humidity is forecast to range from 10 to 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A drastic wind shift to the northwest is forecast between 7 and 10 PM Tuesday evening.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
